node.title: Travellers, states and territories told to 'pay up' millions owed to NSW in quarantine fees
node.alt: a person pushing a trolley with luggage at the airport
node.description: NSW ministers say the state opened its doors to returned travellers from across Australia and kept them safe in hotel quarantine and it was only fair to taxpayers these bills be paid.
node.content:
["Returned travellers and state and territory\u00a0governments owe New South Wales more than $175\u00a0million in unpaid hotel quarantine fees.", "Figures from Revenue NSW show out of the\u00a0142,728 invoices issued as of\u00a0November 11, with 62,426 having been paid and 65,408\u00a0still outstanding \u2014 amounting to $110.3 million.", "It accounts for more than 40 per cent of the total bill for returned travellers.\u00a0", "Queensland, Western Australia and the Northern Territory also owe $65.85 million to the NSW government, under a separate agreement secured in April 2020.", "Victoria, South Australia, the ACT and Tasmania have all squared their bills.", "NSW Treasurer Matt Kean said it was time for these jurisdictions to pay up.", "\"We want them to pay up, they shirked their responsibility during COVID, they locked their citizens out their states and tried to stop them coming home,\" Mr Kean said.", "\"We [NSW] accepted them and it's only fair that those state and territories come good with the money that NSW taxpayers have footed.\"", "", "
Mr Kean says NSW looked after returned travellers from all states and territories.(ABC News)
", "Queensland's Health Minister also weighed into the debate urging residents to pay their bill. However, Mr Kean slammed her comments as \"a bit rich\" given the Queensland government \"won't\".", "Rules around hotel quarantine were introduced last year as the COVID-19 pandemic was taking hold. They were part of a raft of measures put in place to help\u00a0contain the spread of infections.", "Under the pulbic health order, travellers were required to quarantine for 14 days at a designated facility. This is no longer in effect for those fully vaccinated after the restrictions were\u00a0lifted on November 1.", "Fees for international travellers came into effect in July 2020. Before that,\u00a0they weren't charged.", "NSW Minister for Finance and Small Business Damien Tudehope had a similar message to returned travellers\u00a0with outstanding payments.", "\"It is only fair to the rest of the taxpayers in New South Wales that people in hotel quarantine pay their fees due,\" Mr Tudehope said.", "\"Don't put the invoice aside for another day \u2026\u00a0Revenue NSW has a range of options when it comes to resolving these invoices. Get in touch today and get on top of it.\"", "", "
More than 4,800 quarantine hotel invoices have been waived.(AAP: Joel Carrett)
", "More than 4,800 invoices have been waived in line with government guidelines which include a lack of\u00a0capacity to pay and exemptions for Australian Defence Force personnel.", "In a statement Revenue NSW said that while the cost of the quarantine program was significant, the fees were only part of the overall cost incurred by NSW.", "There were 196 locally acquired COVID-19 cases and one death reported in NSW to 8pm last night.", "There are currently 224 people with COVID in hospital, 32 of whom are in intensive care with 16 on ventilators.", "More than 90 per cent of those aged 16 and over are now fully vaccinated and 94 per cent have had at least one dose of a COVID-19 jab.", "", "
How to take a rapid antigen test.
"]
